title: 107_hr2310
content:
The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. Commissioned officers' pay grades and percentage increases based on years of service under section 205 of title 37, United States Code are as follows:
O-10: 7.3%
O-9: 7.3%
O-8: 7.3%
O-7: 7.3%
O-6: 7.3% Commissioned officers' pay grades and percentage increases based on years of service are as follows:
O-7: 7.3%
O-6: 7.3%
O-5: 7.3%
O-4: 9.0%
O-3: 8.3%
O-2: 7.3%
O-1: 7.3%
Over 8: 7.3%
Over 10: 7.3%
Over 12: 7.3%
Over 14: 7.3%
Over 16: 7.3% Commissioned officers' pay grades and percentage increases based on years of service are as follows:
O-7: 7.3%
O-6: 7.3%
O-5: 7.3%
O-4: 9.0%
O-3: 8.3% Commissioned officers' pay grades and percentage increases based on years of service are as follows:
O-4: 9.0%
O-3: 8.3%
O-2: 7.3%
O-1: 7.3%
O-10: 7.3%
O-9: 7.3%
O-8: 7.3% Commissioned officers' pay grades from O-1 to O-9 receive a 7.3% increase, while O-4 receives a 9.0% increase. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer receive a pay increase based on their years of service. The pay grade for O-3E, O-2E, and O-1E officers increases by 8.3% for over 4 years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer receive a pay increase based on their years of service. The pay grade for O-1E, O-2E, and O-3E officers increases by 7.3% for over 8 years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service receive a pay increase based on their years of service. The pay grade for O-1E, O-2E, and O-3E officers increases by 7.3% for over 8 years of service. The pay percentages for officers with over 18, 20, 22, 24, and 26 years of service are all 8.3%. Warrant officers receive pay increases based on their years of service, with percentages ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% depending on their pay grade. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on their years of service and pay grade. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on their years of service and pay grade, with specific percentages for different age brackets. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on their years of service and pay grade. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.5% to 10.5% based on their years of service and pay grade. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on their years of service and pay grade. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on their years of service and pay grade. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on their years of service and pay grade, with specific percentages for different age brackets. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.5% based on their years of service and pay grade. The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002 required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be made.
